Supporting Content

E Books

With today's explosion of modern devices, some consumers like to read their articles on their Kindles or iPads.

Therefore, a method to convert any page of this website into an 'eBook' is auto-built into the top of the navigation stack as well as the footer of every page.

Simply click the eBook icon to render the current page as an Overdrive (.epub) or a Kindle (.mobi) for external reading.

The A's Have It!

In today's complicated world of coding, even the use of the standard hyperlink has come into question.

Therefore, to make it easy for the end-user, this User Interface, or UI will show safe internal links in the bootstrap default color of light dodger blue.

On the other hand, external links, when designated https secure ... Will be shown in the color of forest green.

All other external links designated with standard http will be shown in the color of indian red.

Acronyms

For an acronym to be visually effective when reading a line of text, the acronym must first be declared.

In addition, the acronym must stand out from the body of information.

To accomplsh both of these objectives, the authors have selected Ashley Gold, a primary color within the registered logo badge of the Benefit corporation.

Whenever the end user spies a designated acronym of Ashley Gold color, simply hover over the acronym to reveal the underlying meaning of the acronym letters.

Screen Reponsiveness

This page has been tested for mobile responsiveness on a virtual Galaxy S5 smartphone emulator.

The authors have determined the accuracies of the page renderings at both a portrait width of 360px and a landscape width of 640px.

In addition, pages are also tested against an Amazon Kindle Fire HDX 7, 3rd Generation tablet.

On the Kindle tablet, both portrait and landscape renderings appear accurate, as well.

And, on the Amazon Fire phone, using automatic screen rotation, both portrait and landscape renderings appear accurate.

Navigation

Here, the Navigator <aside> is set for a nine (9) character description of each category.

Though please note some category titles do have ten (10) characters and are therefore best viewed in landscape mode.

Got An Idea?

If you have an idea that will spruce this site up even better than it already is, then you know the drill.

Simply go ahead and fork this repo, make your changes, and send me a pull request.

Carbon Free Footprint

The Carbon Free Footprint project is a division of the Medical Marijuana Initiative of North America - International Limited, an Arizona Benefit corporation.

Note. The repo for the Carbon Free Footprint project has been hard-fork'd to another location at the Git Hub server farm.

Learning the ways of the Javascript Ninja

Note. The Http Headers of this repo are being monitored by Internet Supervision dot com

The MMINAIL

We are dedicated to the preservation of the hard-earned rights of Medical patients to grow up to (12) state-legal Medicinal plants.

*** When residing 25 miles extant of a state legalized dispensary ***

Doesn't that sound a bit strange to you?

Almost Un-constitutional, isn't it?

And, with patients in Arizona paying anywhere from $75 to $90 USD for a quarter ounce of medicine ...

Don't you think it is time that we allow ALL patients the right to grow, stash, and cure their own medicines?

We do at the MMINAIL.

If you agree, why don't you donate a little spare cash?

Or, a little of your coding time?

Or, contact your favorite Arizona State Senators and Congressional Representatives ie.) Congressmen or Congresswomen today!

You'll be glad you did ... and, we'll keep the social advocacy rolling for you.

Both at the State Capitol in Phoenix and also over the Internet!

Thank you for your donation.

Reproduction In Part

Most authors will allow the reproduction of their works in part when the case of brief quotations embodied in critical articles or reviews is addressed.

Therefore, please remember to provide a Link-back to the original author, or to the publisher of the original publication when citing.

Thank you for your consideration.

Learn Markdown

Welcome! This is the Learn Markdown page of the MMINAIL.

Note. Jekyll is best served as a Ruby gem. Therefore, you must have an updated copy of Ruby on your machine.

Some people have two copies of Ruby on their development machine.

One instance being the original 'system' configuration that came bundled with their machine ...

And, the other instance relative to their administrative instant User account.

For further info, see the Ruby Macports 2nd Instance page of this repo ...

Or, simply scroll down to the Homebrew directory in the Navigator aside ➡️ and explode the submenu by clicking on the brew icon.

Now, click on Ruby Macports to learn how to make a Binary Archive from source.

How To Start The Local Jekyll Server In Mac Os Sierra

  1. Go to your locally configured repo in the Finder
  2. Right click over the folder name
  3. Expose the Services menu
  4. Open a 'new Terminal at folder'

Once a Terminal window is open with the directory pointing to the folder of your repo ...

  1. Input the following line of code at the Terminal $ prompt
Starting the local Jekyll server ...

Server now running... press control-c to stop.

Note. Once you have entered the local Jekyll server start command into the Terminal, you may subsequently simply scroll up the Terminal history to accept the command in the future.

  1. Now, open up your chrome browser
  2. And, type this address in the URL location bar of your browser window ... http://localhost:4000/

  3. Hit the Enter key to navigate to the local rendering of your repo
    Finito!  Thank you for your financial support and expert coding!

Can You Contribute?

In the <aside> section of this website ➡️ , you will find a navigation column.

When the end-user clicks on a topic of interest, the menu explodes vertically to reveal several Sub-menu choices.

There is a 'Learn-Topic' selection just north of the Home page divider for each topic of interest.

You, as the current end-user, are now at one of those 'Learn-Topic' pages, specifically the {title} ( Learn Jekyll ) page.

If you are an expert in your field of specialty, then I suggest you fork the working repo of this Website and create a Sub-menu choice of your choosing.

As we rely heavily upon contributions from the coding community, your contribution of either cash or code will be greatly appreciated.

Time Management

How much of your coding time are you willing to invest in this project?

As we can now decipher the time spent by our functions at the code block level ... 

Setting the time wrapper for the execution of a function ...

Keep a-track of your coding time.

Finito! ... 

Thank you for your contribution.
